author: stop-cran@list.ru
body:
Only since v8.13 is it possible to use `apply` on multiple hypotheses
simultaneously.

The functions `curry` and `uncurry` only exist since Coq v8.13 and were
earlier called `prod_uncurry` and `prod_curry`. But the latter got
deprecated. To ensure compatibility with Coq v8.12 (and simplifying the
code a little when using `f1` but complicating the def. of `f1`) the
definition of `f1` is changed a little.

This theorem is only available in Coq v8.13 and later. To stay
compatible with Coq v8.12, this theorem has to be avoided.

author: 8899730+Columbus240@users.noreply.github.com
message: Compact Hausdorff implies normal. Without choice
body:
By juggling around, one can prove "compact Hausdorff spaces are normal"
without using choice. The relevant facts are, that "compactness is a
kind of choice property" and "finite sets have choice (exploitable by
induction)".

The lemma `compact_Hausdorff_impl_T3_sep_lemma` should get another name
and be moved to ZornsLemma.

The approach of the proof is pretty clear (whatever that means), and the
new proof has about the same length as the one based on choice (not
counting the new lemmas).

I created a new file `Finite_sets.v` (in allusion to the corresponding
file in the stdlib), because we don't have a file yet that is *only*
concerned with `Finite`. The best would have been `FiniteTypes.v`, but
this is all about `FiniteT`.

author: 8899730+Columbus240@users.noreply.github.com
body:
Stating the lemma like this, the user doesn't have to use
proof-irrelevance to make his term equal to `quotient_projection R x`.
But on the other hand, the user of the lemma currently has to use
`unfold` on `quotient_projection R x` before he can do the rewrite.
This is less convenient and makes this change breaking.

author: 8899730+Columbus240@users.noreply.github.com

This hides the destructuring of the pair inside the projection maps.
This makes proofs of `continuous_2arg` a lot easier, because now the
continuity of the projections and continuity of composition can be used
easier than before.

author: 8899730+Columbus240@users.noreply.github.com
body:
Split up a lemma, because coq has trouble with `rewrite` if the theorem
has the form `_ <-> (_ = _)`. Its difficult to apply such theorems with
out using `proj1` or `proj2`.

author: 8899730+Columbus240@users.noreply.github.com
body:
The definition `open_ball` is of type `forall (X : Type)
(d : X -> X -> R) (x : X) (r : R), Ensemble X`. The argument `X` is now
implicit, because it can be inferred from `d`. This simplifies using
this set.

The lemma `metric_space_open_ball_open` has been generalized. We show
that open balls are open even if their radius is non-positive. The main
benefit of this is, that we don't have to check the radius when using
that open balls are open, since in most cases we deal with positive
radii.

Closed balls are now defined in metric spaces (see `closed_ball`). Some
minor calculation lemmas about containment were proved. And closed balls
are topologically closed.

The proofs of `closer_to_S_than_T_open` and `metrizable_impl_normal_sep`
were restructured and reformatted. The fact that metrizable spaces
satisfy `T1_sep` has now its own lemma `metrizable_impl_T1_sep` and uses
the machinery of closed balls for a shorter and simpler proof.

In `metrizable_impl_normal_sep` a lot of indentation levels could be
eliminated, by appropriately reordering goals. The approach should now
be more visible.

`finite_dec_exists`, `finite_dec_forall`, `finite_eq_dec`.

author: aspiwack@0cf17b13-060f-0410-b1b1-c666bec9822a
message: Topology: fix uses of refine, names
body:
- A use of refine with fresh
- Reliance on the renaming policy of refine
- Change in the semantics of refine (let x := _ in _ ) (may
   require extra cleabody and shelve_unifiable)

git-svn-id: svn://scm.gforge.inria.fr/svnroot/coq-contribs/trunk@2423 0cf17b13-060f-0410-b1b1-c666bec9822a

author: aspiwack@0cf17b13-060f-0410-b1b1-c666bec9822a
message: ZornsLemma: uses of fresh with refine.
body:
The refine tactic was never compatible with fresh (or any identifier passed as an ltac variable). The refine tactic actually did some "fresh" of its own, hence giving the impression that the call to fresh was effective. The slight change on that respect in new-tacticals revealed the bug.

git-svn-id: svn://scm.gforge.inria.fr/svnroot/coq-contribs/trunk@2422 0cf17b13-060f-0410-b1b1-c666bec9822a

author: herbelin@0cf17b13-060f-0410-b1b1-c666bec9822a
message: Fixing scripts wrt to incompatibility following full support for meta pattern unification in apply (i.e. even when args are variables of the context and not only locally bound variables).
body:
Unfortunately, a bug in the recursive use of apply through conjunction
makes that the 2nd component of the open_neighborhood_basis_elements
field (of conclusion "In U a") is applied before the 1st component (of
conclusion "open U") which is the expected one (and which was actually
called before pattern unification allowed "In U a" to be used). Fixed
the problem by setting "In" opaque.

git-svn-id: svn://scm.gforge.inria.fr/svnroot/coq-contribs/trunk@1520 0cf17b13-060f-0410-b1b1-c666bec9822a

author: letouzey@0cf17b13-060f-0410-b1b1-c666bec9822a
message: Adaptations to the new modular organisation of PArith/NArith/ZArith
body:
- Notations (x ?= y)%positive are now complete, applying them
   to Eq such as in ((x ?= y)%positive Eq) isn't correct anymore.
   For porting code, a first solution is to simply erase this Eq
   argument. But this could lead to later fix in proofs (such as
   a few unfold), since (x ?= y) is now pointing to
   (Pos.compare x y), which is convertible but not syntactically
   equal to (Pos.compare_cont x y) (the former Pcompare x y Eq).
   So replacing the notation ?= by explicit Pcompare might be
   preferable when porting code. Another solution used in a few cases
   in this commit is to locally override the new notation by adding
   this at the top of the contrib:

    Infix "?=" := Pcompare : positive_scope.

 - Proofs that involves the internals of Z.add (ex-Zplus) will
   probably involve now Z.pos_sub, the signed difference of two
   positive. These proofs have been repaired by converting this
   Z.pos_sub to the earlier internal formulation of Zplus, by some
   rewrite Z.pos_sub_spec and possibly some unfold of Pos.compare

 - Pmult_nat is now just a compatibility notation for (Pos.iter_op plus),
   hence unfold of Pmult_nat will fail, and should be replaced by
   unfold of Pos.iter_op.

 - When a tactic such as destruct generates an hypothesis name,
   it is based on the basename of the head of this hypothesis.
   Since Zlt, Zle, Zgt, Zge are now compatibility notations for
   Z.lt, Z.le, Z.gt, Z.ge, the generated names are now l, l0 or g, g0
   instead of z, z0, ... A few fragile scripts with explicit
   references to automatically introduced names have been fixed.

 - A few fixes concern extraction: since the standard library has 
   changed, so has the extracted code...

 - Contribs containing ml code (e.g. tactics) that refer to positive/N/Z
   constant is to adapt, since these constant are to be searched in
   Coq.Numbers.BinNums.

 - Boolean tests {Z,N,Pos}.eqb are now noted "_ =? _". Beware of
   Ltac patterns such as ?x=?y, they should be rewritten as ?x = ?y.



git-svn-id: svn://scm.gforge.inria.fr/svnroot/coq-contribs/trunk@1436 0cf17b13-060f-0410-b1b1-c666bec9822a
